## Description {#details}

As we analyze each global or thread-local variable, keep track of some information about it.

If we find out that the address of the global is taken, none of this info will be accurate.

Definition at line 30 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/utils/globalstatus-h">GlobalStatus.h</a>.

<SectionDefinition>

## Enumerations

### enum  {#abe8cd5e07daf1b2bf532174823523ee7}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="enum llvm::GlobalStatus::StoredType ">
Keep track of what stores to the global look like.

<EnumerationList title="Enumeration values">

<Link id="abe8cd5e07daf1b2bf532174823523ee7ae2ae8bccbba8e261ad5d71d3a84ce295" />
<EnumerationListItem name="NotStored">
There is no store to this global. It can thus be marked constant
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="abe8cd5e07daf1b2bf532174823523ee7adcbfa969dc654b5812a05827152a42c5" />
<EnumerationListItem name="InitializerStored">
This global is stored to, but the only thing stored is the constant it was initialized with
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="abe8cd5e07daf1b2bf532174823523ee7aecd55f74522361f4b8056f8b6b745699" />
<EnumerationListItem name="StoredOnce">
This global is stored to, but only its initializer and one other value is ever stored to it
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="abe8cd5e07daf1b2bf532174823523ee7a3b94935998fa471818fb34bceb4c1357" />
<EnumerationListItem name="Stored">
This global is stored to by multiple values or something else that we cannot track
</EnumerationListItem>

</EnumerationList>

</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>

## Public Member Attributes

### AccessingFunction {#abdf22b304eab8994314a2a89c00103fc}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>const Function&#42; llvm::GlobalStatus::AccessingFunction = nullptr</>}>
These start out null/false.

When the first accessing function is noticed, it is recorded. When a second different accessing function is noticed, HasMultipleAccessingFunctions is set to true.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/utils/globalstatus-h/#l00076">76</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/utils/globalstatus-h">GlobalStatus.h</a>.

### IsLoaded {#a0371d896aba2b285da63fca3b700b169}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool llvm::GlobalStatus::IsLoaded = false">
True if the global is ever loaded.

If the global isn&#39;t ever loaded it can be deleted.

## Public Static Functions

### analyzeGlobal() {#ae58ea7b3b03443e976cbef09ac25cf00}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool GlobalStatus::analyzeGlobal (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; V, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/globalstatus">GlobalStatus</a> &amp; GS)</>}

Look at all uses of the global and fill in the <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/globalstatus">GlobalStatus</a> structure.

If the global has its address taken, return true to indicate we can&#39;t do anything with it.
